translated: and to be able to eat;
For one who is not deceitful, good,

analyzed: na pāpam upalimpati  ñātakaḥ naḥ nisinnaḥ iti
bahu āgacchate jano  paṭicca kammam phusati
translated: “Many people come to me,🔽thinking ‘Our relative is sitting here’;🔽Because of that, my mind is anxious,

original: tasmiṁ me saṅkate mano”.🔽“Na paṭicca kammaṁ phusati,
analyzed: tasmin me saṅkate mano  na paṭicca kammam phusati
translated: as I touch the results of my actions.”🔽“If your mind does not incline,

The Birth Story of Tittira, the ninth.
